glsa.title: SQUASHFS: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in SQUASHFS, the worst of which may allow execution of arbitrary code

background.p: Squashfs is a compressed read-only filesystem for Linux. Squashfs is intended for general read-only filesystem use, for archival use (i.e. in cases where a .tar.gz file may be used), and in constrained block device/memory systems (e.g. embedded systems) where low overhead is needed.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in SQUASHFS. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: Remote attackers, by enticing a user to process a specially crafted SQUASHFS image, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
